intro: Caraguata violacea, commonly known as the violet caraguata, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a soft, hairy texture. Caraguata violacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
